I don't "hate" tanks, but what they have become in League is not what a tank should be.  

Damage creep has made it so that tanks can easily out-damage melee fighters/carries late game.  I've used 3-4 spell rotations as a mage against a tank and they survived while still managing to blow up one of my carries in the fight.  Tanks SHOULD be able to absorb copious amounts of damage, yes, but the trade-off should ALWAYS be that they lose damage in doing so.  

Almost every tank in League of Legends is capable of blowing up a carry even if they build absolutely no damage.  Early game, I'm fine with it---high base damage helps get tanks through the laning phase, but their scaling should be low if not completely pitiful.  

And herein lies the tug of war on the Boards...

Some people believe tanks should be utterly garbage through the game and only capable of soaking up damage in teamfights... others think tanks should outscale damage/carries late game.  Both ends of that spectrum are absurd and would lead to a completely irrelevant class of champion or games that last 90 minutes respectively.

I don't think nor do I even believe that tanks outscale carries late game. 

Damage creep hurt carries in the long run. The defensive boost next patch might solve this problem.

This.

I've seen videos about the tank meta and how boring people thought it was. But for me, it was a wet dream. This is what tanks should really be in my opinion: damage sponges. They take all the damage without dying, while dealing little damage. This is what a tank should be. But because people found that boring, we now have these big looking champs that are getting shredded by adc in seconds, but can deal massive amounts of damage.
Lol, go play like 3 games of HotS, and you will find new appreciation for the tanks in League.  Their tanks are twice as bulky and hit twice as hard.

**Leans forward angrily in rocking chair**
Back in my day, getting one shot meant you got Deathfire Grasped by an LB in a quarter of second...
back in my day, DFG's active had ap scaling so veigar could one shot anyone with just the item active!

Haha, yeah, he'd one shot someone with his ult and then a 2nd person with DFG -_-

Man I have a really unhealthy sense of nostalgia for old League of Legends...

To be fair.

Back then League was more of a "game" and less of a "competitive Sport"
What's the difference to your mind? I'm genuinely curious.

Back in the day there were a lot of things that were objectively overpowered and unhealthy, yet people didn't really seem to care an awful lot about it.

We had 90% ban rate Kassadin, yet nobody played him in normals.
There was stuff like AP YI and Tryndamere, DFG one shots and overall the game didn't really seem to be based around actually winning and more about *just* having fun and messing around.

Nowadays Ranked and Normals are pretty much the same and you don't feel ranked being more professional or more *tryhardy*.

IMO the game was more streamlined once you guys at Riot figured out a *design compass* on what to orient yourself when designing your game.
Overall the way the game is supported/handled and everything feeling more professional is what makes me feel it has become more like a sport and not something quirky and weird like it used to be in its original form.

Or maybe I'm just looking at it through rose-tinted goggles, it's been almost five years now since I started playing.

I think off tank was a pretty common term, referring to anyone tanky enough to be a frontline presence.

But years ago the phrase off tank was understood to be not a tank. Malphite with no damage was a tank. A scarner with triforce was not a tank. He was an off tank. Or a bruiser. The problem is that off tank build are being considered tank builds when they just are not.

For a tank, tankiness is the end.
